content.title: Intro
content.content:
1933
Preceded by
1933
1934
Year
1935
Followed by
1935
You may also be looking for Third Age 1934.

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1934.

content.title: January
content.content:
10 - Arne Zettersten, colleague and friend of J.R.R. Tolkien, is born.
18 - The poem Looney is published.
21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 8a.

content.title: February
content.content:
12 - Actress Annette Crosbie is born.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien's poem "The Adventures of Tom Bombadil" is published in The Oxford Magazine.
17 - Actor Barry Humphries is born.

content.title: March
content.content: 25 - J.R.R. Tolkien's poem Firiel is published within The Chronicle of the Convents of the Sacred Heart (Volume IV).

content.title: June
content.content:
20 - Artist Heinz Edelmann is born.
? - The second half of J.R.R. Tolkien's essay "Sigelwara Land" is published in Medium Aevum.

content.title: August
content.content:
9 - Tolkien's portrait by artist F.A. Farrell is published in the Australian Catholic journal The Advocate.
16 - Author Diana Wynne Jones is born.

content.title: November
content.content: 20 - Father Christmas writes a letter to Christopher Tolkien.

content.title: December
content.content:
23 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to G.H. Cowling.
24 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.

? - Chaucer as a Philologist: The Reeve's Tale is published.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien receives the two-year Leverhulme Research Fellowship.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien's "Chaucer as a Philologist" is published in Transactions of the Philological Society.
? - Artist Maret Kernumees is born.
? - Artist Cor Blok is born.
Years
1931 1932 1933 1934 1935 1936 1937
